original_title: Sri Lanka shares slip on profit taking in Banking and financial sectors
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka shares slipped on Friday as profit taking entered the market mainly on banking and diversified financial sectors, brokers said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) closed down 0.99 percent, or 96.52 points, at 9,606.96.
“Profit taking took place mainly in the banking sector as the market was running on green for the past two weeks,” an analyst said.
“At the moment there is a lot of Positivity among investors and they are not really holding shares for the longer term at the moment,

After getting China’s assurance on debt restructuring and sending the letter of Intent for the IMF executive board approval President Ranil Wickremesinghe, on Tuesday, said it is expected to receive the Executive Board approval in the third or fourth week of March.
The market saw a net foreign inflow of 73.1 million rupees. So far in 2023, the market has recorded a total net foreign inflow of 3.4 billion rupees.
The most liquid index, S&P SL20, closed 1.49 percent, or 42.79 points, up at 2,823.14.
The market saw a turnover of 1.7 billion rupees on Friday, slightly lower than this year’s daily average of 1.9 billion rupees.
The top gainers were Commercial Bank, Sampath Bank, Melstacorp. (Colombo/Mar 10/2023)
